On DATE a group of CARDINAL women , including the applicant , entered the LOC of the provincial branch of ORG in GPE after a press conference had been held by the party ’s Vice - President . They occupied the LOC with the aim of protesting against a meeting which would be held there and attended by the party members . The security forces attempted to lead the women out of the building in order to prevent possible clashes between them and the party members . CARDINAL of the women , including the applicant , resisted the police and used physical violence . All CARDINAL women were then arrested and taken to the LOC branch of ORG for a medical examination . Subsequently , they were taken to the LOC police headquarters .

CARDINAL . NORP The police took statements from GPE , who maintained that the women who had occupied the LOC had beaten CARDINAL party members and deprived him of his liberty . He further stated that they had resisted the police officers during the arrest .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG public prosecutor filed a bill of indictment with ORG , charging CARDINAL women with resisting the police and depriving PERSON of his liberty for ideological reasons .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG acquitted the applicant and the other accused . In its judgment , the trial court noted that the accused women were members of “ Mothers for Peace ” and that they had visited ORG in order to hold a meeting with the members of that party with a view to informing them of their problems . The court further noted that there was no evidence in the case file demonstrating that the members of “ Mothers for Peace ” had committed an offence . In particular , they had not deprived PERSON of his liberty or damaged the building . Nor had they had any objects on their person which could have been used to commit offences . Furthermore , no complaint had been lodged against them by the party members who had allegedly been beaten by them . The court further observed that there was no evidence that the accused had resisted the police as no officer had been injured in the course of the arrest . On the contrary , some of the women , including the applicant , had sustained injuries .
